Title: Verify Patient Registration
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully register on the application.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in all required fields with valid data. 3. Submit the registration form.
Data: Valid patient registration data (e.g., name, email, password).
Result: The patient should be successfully registered, and a confirmation message should be displayed.

Title: Verify Doctor Login
Description: Verify that a doctor can successfully log in to the application.
Precondition: The doctor must be registered in the system.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Result: The doctor should be successfully logged in, and the dashboard should be displayed.

Title: Verify Appointment Booking
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully book an appointment with a diagnostic center.
Precondition: The patient must be logged in.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Search for available time slots. 3. Select a time slot and submit the booking.
Result: The appointment should be successfully booked, and a confirmation message should be displayed.

Title: Verify Invalid Login Attempt
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid login attempts gracefully.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Click the login button.
Data: Invalid credentials (e.g., incorrect username or password).
Result: An error message should be displayed, and the user should not be logged in.

Title: Verify Boundary Value for Password Length
Description: Verify that the system enforces the password length requirement.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in all required fields with valid data. 3. Enter a password that is exactly at the minimum length boundary. 4. Submit the registration form.
Data: Password with minimum length boundary value.
Result: The registration should be successful if the password meets the length requirement.

Title: Validate System Response Time Under Load
Description: Ensure the application maintains acceptable response times under high user load.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Simulate 1000 concurrent users accessing the application. 2. Measure the average response time for key functionalities (e.g., login, appointment booking). 3. Compare the response time against the defined performance threshold.
Action: Simulate high user load and measure response times.
Result: The average response time should be within the defined performance threshold.

Title: Test Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Verify that users can only access functionalities permitted by their roles.
Precondition: User accounts for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Diagnostic Center functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient and Doctor functionalities.
Result: Access should be denied for restricted functionalities.

Title: Verify User Interface Clarity and Intuitiveness
Description: Ensure that the user interface is easy to navigate and understand.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running.
Steps: 1. Perform a usability test with a group of users who are new to the application. 2. Ask users to complete common tasks (e.g., booking an appointment, viewing reports). 3. Collect feedback on the ease of use and clarity of the interface.
Action: Conduct usability testing with new users.
Result: Users should be able to complete tasks with minimal assistance and provide positive feedback on the interface.

Title: Assess System Behavior Under Failure Conditions
Description: Ensure the system can handle failures gracefully and recover quickly.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate a database failure. 2. Observe the system's behavior and error handling. 3. Measure the mean time to recovery.
Action: Simulate a database failure and observe system behavior.
Result: The system should handle the failure gracefully, and the mean time to recovery should be within acceptable limits.

Title: Check System Performance as User Load Increases
Description: Ensure the application can handle an increasing number of users without degradation in performance.
Precondition: The application is deployed and running in a staging environment.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 concurrent users and gradually increase to 1000 users. 2. Monitor the system's performance metrics (e.g., response time, CPU usage, memory usage). 3. Ensure that performance remains within acceptable limits.
Action: Gradually increase user load and monitor performance.
Result: The system should maintain acceptable performance metrics as the user load increases.

Title: Validate User Login with Correct Credentials
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to log in with valid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter valid username and password. 3. Click on the login button.
Result: The user should be successfully logged into the system.

Title: Attempt Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Verify that the system prevents unauthorized access by rejecting invalid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Click on the login button.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent access.

Title: Test for SQL Injection in Login Form
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to SQL injection attacks through the login form.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter SQL injection payloads (e.g., ' OR '1'='1) in the username and/or password fields. 3. Click on the login button.
Result: The system should reject the input and display an error message.

Title: Verify Session Timeout
Description: Ensure that the system logs out the user after a period of inactivity.
Precondition: The user is logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Log in to the system. 2. Remain inactive for the specified timeout period. 3. Attempt to perform an action that requires authentication.
Action: Remaining inactive for the timeout period
Result: The system should log out the user and redirect to the login page.

Title: Test for Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in User Input Fields
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to XSS attacks through user input fields.
Precondition: The user is logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Navigate to a page with user input fields (e.g., search doctorâ€™s information). 2. Enter XSS payloads (e.g., <script>alert('XSS')</script>) in the input fields. 3. Submit the form.
Action: Entering XSS payloads in user input fields
Result: The system should sanitize the input and display an error message or the input without executing the script.

Title: Load Test - Patient Registration
Description: Simulate multiple patients registering simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 100 users accessing the registration page concurrently. 2. Each user fills out the registration form with unique data. 3. Each user submits the registration form. 4. Measure the response time for each registration process. 5. Monitor system resource utilization (CPU, memory, etc.).
Data: Unique registration data for each user.
Result: All users should be able to register successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 5 seconds).

Title: Stress Test - Doctor Appointment Booking
Description: Push the system to its limits by simulating a high number of appointment bookings to identify breaking points.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 500 users trying to book appointments concurrently. 2. Each user searches for a doctor and selects an available time slot. 3. Each user confirms the appointment. 4. Measure the system's response time and stability. 5. Monitor system resource utilization and error rates.
Result: The system should handle the load with minimal errors and maintain stability.

Title: Endurance Test - Continuous Patient Login
Description: Evaluate the system's ability to sustain a prolonged load of patient logins over an extended period.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 users logging in every minute for 24 hours. 2. Each user logs in with valid credentials. 3. Measure the system's response time and stability over the duration. 4. Monitor system resource utilization and error rates.
Action: Simulate continuous login activity for 24 hours.
Data: Valid login credentials for each user.
Result: The system should maintain stable performance with minimal errors throughout the test.

Title: Scalability Test - Increasing Number of Diagnostic Center Users
Description: Determine the system's ability to handle an increasing number of diagnostic center users.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Start with 10 diagnostic center users and increment by 10 users every hour up to 100 users. 2. Each user performs various actions such as searching patients, updating records, and viewing appointments. 3. Measure the system's response time and stability at each increment. 4. Monitor system resource utilization and error rates.
Action: Incrementally increase the number of diagnostic center users.
Data: Diagnostic center user data and actions.
Result: The system should handle the increasing load with acceptable performance and stability.

Title: Load Test - Concurrent Access to Patient Reports
Description: Simulate multiple users accessing patient reports concurrently to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 200 users accessing patient reports concurrently. 2. Each user searches for and views a specific patient report. 3. Measure the system's response time for each report access. 4. Monitor system resource utilization (CPU, memory, etc.).
Action: Simulate 200 users accessing patient reports concurrently.
Result: All users should be able to access the reports successfully within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 3 seconds).

Title: Test Minimum Length of Username
Description: Verify that the system allows login with the minimum acceptable username length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with the minimum length (assuming minimum length is 5 characters, e.g., "user"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Result: The system should allow login successfully.

Title: Test Maximum Length of Username
Description: Verify that the system allows login with the maximum acceptable username length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with the maximum length (assuming maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "maximumlengthusername"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Result: The system should allow login successfully.

Title: Test Just Below Minimum Length of Username
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with a username length just below the minimum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with a length just below the minimum (assuming minimum length is 5 characters, e.g., "use"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with username length just below minimum
Result: The system should not allow login and display an error message.

Title: Test Just Above Maximum Length of Username
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with a username length just above the maximum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter a username with a length just above the maximum (assuming maximum length is 20 characters, e.g., "maximumlengthusernamet"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Action: Login with username length just above maximum
Result: The system should not allow login and display an error message.

Title: Test Invalid Input for Username
Description: Verify that the system does not allow login with an invalid username format.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username format (e.g., "user@name"). 3. Enter a valid password. 4. Click the login button.
Result: The system should not allow login and display an error message.

Title: Verify Password Requirements
Description: Ensure that the system enforces password requirements such as length, special characters, expiry, and recycling policies.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Attempt to create a new account with a password that does not meet the required criteria (e.g., less than 8 characters, no special characters). 3. Attempt to create a new account with a password that meets the required criteria. 4. Attempt to change an existing password to one that does not meet the required criteria. 5. Attempt to change an existing password to one that meets the required criteria.
Action: Creating and changing passwords with valid and invalid criteria.
Result: The system should prevent the creation or change of passwords that do not meet the required criteria and allow those that do.

Title: Verify Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Ensure that the system enforces access control based on user roles (Patient, Doctor, Diagnostic Center).
Precondition: User accounts for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center roles are created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient. 2. Attempt to access Doctor-specific functionalities (e.g., manage appointments). 3. Log in as a Doctor. 4. Attempt to access Diagnostic Center-specific functionalities (e.g., upload reports). 5. Log in as a Diagnostic Center. 6. Attempt to access Patient-specific functionalities (e.g., view reports).
Action: Logging in with different user roles and attempting to access restricted functionalities.
Result: The system should prevent access to functionalities that are not permitted for the logged-in user role.

Title: Verify Data Classification and Protection
Description: Ensure that all data is protectively marked, stored, and protected according to relevant regulations.
Precondition: Data is entered into the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient. 2. View personal health information. 3. Log in as a Doctor. 4. View patient records. 5. Log in as a Diagnostic Center. 6. View and edit patient test results.
Result: The system should ensure that sensitive data is only accessible to authorized users and is protected from unauthorized access.

Title: Verify Inactivity Timeout
Description: Ensure that the system enforces inactivity timeouts to enhance security.
Precondition: A user is logged into the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient. 2. Remain inactive for the specified timeout period. 3. Attempt to perform an action after the timeout period.
Action: Remaining inactive and attempting to perform an action after the timeout period.
Result: The system should log out the user after the inactivity timeout period and require re-authentication.

Title: Verify Data Integrity for Test Reports
Description: Ensure that test reports are processed accurately and any incorrect reports are flagged to prevent false medication.
Precondition: Test reports are generated and available in the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Doctor. 2. View test reports for a patient. 3. Identify any discrepancies or incorrect data in the test reports. 4. Log in as a Diagnostic Center. 5. Edit the test reports to correct any discrepancies.
Data: Test reports with correct and incorrect data.
Result: The system should flag incorrect reports and allow authorized users to correct them.
